revised_title: Variation in Lotus corniculatus and Trifolium repens: A Study of Cyanophoric Plants
tldr: This study investigates the variation in Lotus corniculatus and Trifolium repens plants, focusing on their cyanophoric properties. The authors find that while some plants contain a cyanogen glucoside and the corresponding enzyme, others do not. They also observe differences in enzymic activity among specimens from various locations, suggesting a correlation between the presence of the cyanophoric glucoside and the enzyme.
